ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Ero indeciso se acquistarle o meno. Alla fine l'ho fatto e devo dire che sono rimasto molto soddisfatto. La qualità è ottimo, il prodotto arriva imballato perfettamente.La qualità del suono e del microfono sono ottime. Il suono forse non è altissimo, però è alto, e detto francamente devo tenere il volume del pc Windows a 40 quanto vedo una siete tv, quindi penso che sia ottimo, almeno per me.Il design è accattivante, io le ho prese bianche e nere e sono rimasto soddisfatto, il cavo è lungo e soddisfa ogni aspettativa. Beh che dire è corsair ed è un ottimo prodotto. Il colore lo si può impostare tramite pc.L'unica attenzione è che sono cuffie grandi, quindi potrebbe non andare bene a chi ha una testa piccola, a me per fortuna vanno alla perfezione, con un piccolo svantaggio forse. Del resto sono ottime

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: before we go into the my review i need to point out I've owned numerous headsets from logi, HyprX, turtle beach over the years, so far i owned 3 Logitech (all broke), 1 Hyper-X (not ergonomic for me), 3 Turtle beach (wire gave up), but so far this is the best flipping headset I've seen, felt, and wore in a long time.firstly the built quality is absolutely amazing, from the moment i pulled it out the box, and put it on my head although the weight at first was quiet a bit off putting but I've wore this headset for about 6 hours in a row so far with limited breaks (mainly toilet and water breaks) and i have not taken the weight into account at all, i believe that it is extremely well distributed around the headset AND FOR ONCE i don't have to amputate my leg just to hide the pain i get from taking off the headset as others in the past were just so uncomfortable to wear so when you'd take it off it would leave behind an excruciating pain but this one HELL NO it is perfectly built.The sound quality honestly blew me away... the base, the voice clarity and also how versatile this headset is while using the iCUE settings. Versatility is a BIG yes on this one. I can play my games like, R6S, Hell Let Loose, Post Scriptum, BF 1, Stellaris, MOWAS2, SW BF 2, PUBG, cheeki bit of fortnite, League of legends etc... it is also amazing to listen to music in it.i will be updating this review within the next 3-4 weeks and so on and on for you people.  <<<<Update 1>>>>Alright it may have been more than about 4 weeks however i promised updates on this for you guys.<< Durability and versatility>>So far the headset hasn't shown any sign of breaking yet however i do use extreme precaution when using it as all 3 of my past headsets for pc broke in similar ways having the support for the speakers completely disintegrated within the first 4 weeks (Logitech). This one however is still strong and still feels like it is brand new, no damage, no sound bug, no weird buzzing sound or echos in the background. The ear cushion is probably one of the best that I've ever seen and used, i never had my ears burning up with them specially recently with the heat wave we just had... heat was never an issue. it is also very adjustable and i have a big head and even still i don't need to extend the size by that much and it is still great.<<Performance>>This headset is basically what you need for games, music, movies, video and music editing etc... the bass is not really ear or brain shaking by itself nor with the ICUE software which honestly is not a problem and most people just wouldn't care to be honest as the sound is already godlike as it is, but for me i just like bassy songs so i just downloaded a bass amplifier and i was all sorted.<<weight>>honestly it feels heavy but it isn't heavy if that makes sense? I think it is mostly due to how well it grips on your head which make it feel like that but overall i can have this headset on for like 10 hours with minor breaks in between and it still doesn't bother me. weight distribution is also on point!<<issues>>The only issue i have with it is the wire, it tangles after a while and it is hard to get it back to normal as some curves and knots remains, however it isn't that annoying and doesn't really affect the performance or quality but never the less it is there.Overall still an amazing headset.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 June 2019

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: I've had these for 24 hours after returning the hyper x cloud stinger s 7.1 headset I had bought. Initially I was worried the 7.1 surround sound would have the same issues as the hyper x and that they wouldn't be comfortable as many have said but after having them recommend by friends who have the pro version undecided to take the plunge and boy am I grateful that I did . They are nice and comfortable not to loose ( I do have a big head ) the sound is amazing the voices from my friends while talking on discord is nice and clear with the mic picking up my voice nice and clear too . The noise cancelling is top notch as I vape and non of my friends could hear when I did vape it also cut out my music from my phone which I purposely turned the volume up to max and held the phone to the mic with no noise coming through only while I spoke . Volume control is super easy  switching from different sound settings is as easy as pressing the volume control on the left ear cup and switching from 7.1 to stereo is just press and hold the switch . You get a decent length of cable with a usb connection . Would I recommend these to people hell yeah I would and I'd buy them again if this set ever broke
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 July 2021

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Had the first Corsair Void RGB and just wanted to upgrade to my favorite gaming headset! No problem with a large head and ears as I have. :D

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Ich habe mir das Corsair Void Elite RGB Wireless Gaming Headset für meine Playstation 5 gekauft und bin nach zwei Jahren intensiver Nutzung immer noch absolut begeistert von seiner Leistung. Dieses Headset ist ein absolutes Muss für jeden, der ein immersives Gaming-Erlebnis sucht, insbesondere bei Shootern.Der 7.1 Surround Sound des Headsets ist beeindruckend. Ich konnte jedes Detail in meinen Lieblingsshootern hören, sei es das leise Schleichen meiner Gegner oder die Explosionen in der Ferne. Der Klang ist klar und präzise, was mir einen klaren Vorteil im Spiel verschafft.Die kabellose Verbindung des Headsets ist zuverlässig und bietet eine Reichweite von bis zu 12 Metern. Ich konnte mich frei bewegen, ohne mich um Kabel oder Einschränkungen kümmern zu müssen. Die ultraschnelle Latenz sorgt dafür, dass der Ton synchron mit dem Gameplay bleibt und ein reibungsloses Spielerlebnis gewährleistet wird.Die Akkulaufzeit des Headsets hat zwar nach zwei Jahren etwas nachgelassen, ist aber immer noch voll ausreichend. Ich kann immer noch einen Ganzen Tag am Stück spielen, bevor ich es wieder aufladen muss. Das Aufladen selbst geht schnell und unkompliziert.Das Design des Headsets ist modern und ansprechend. Die RGB-Beleuchtung verleiht ihm einen coolen Look und lässt sich individuell anpassen. Der Tragekomfort ist ebenfalls hervorragend, auch bei längeren Gaming-Sessions.Insgesamt bin ich mit dem Corsair Void Elite RGB Wireless Gaming Headset äußerst zufrieden und kann es jedem Gamer empfehlen, der ein hochwertiges und immersives Audioerlebnis sucht. Der Surround Sound, die kabellose Verbindung und der Tragekomfort machen dieses Headset zu einem unverzichtbaren Zubehör für Shooter auf der Playstation 5. Trotz nachlassender Akkulaufzeit nach zwei Jahren immer noch 5 Sterne!

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Op zich ben ik redelijk te spreken over deze headset wat betreft geluidskwaliteit van de speakers en de microfoon.Waar ik iets minder over te spreken ben is de bouwkealiteit. Dit is ondertussen mijn tweede exemplaar. Eerste headset ging de mute knop van kapot binnen 3 maanden (Knop bleef hangen en stuurde meerdere inputs). Bij de tweede begint nu binnen nog geen jaar de power knop al wat te blijven hangen. Het flip to mute systeem van de microfoon is onbetrouwbaar. De ene keer werkt het prima, maar op andere momenten moet je de microfoon een tweede keer "flippen" voordat hij werkt. Het rode "mute" ledje gaat telkens wel uit, maar de mic geeft geen geluid door.Accu gaat ook wat korter mee dan verwacht en je moet de icue software blijven gebruiken om de leds op de oorschelpen uit te kunnen zetten. Dit kan dus niet via een knop en wordt ook niet opgeslagen.Ander minpuntje is micro usb voor het laden. Dat gaat minder lang mee vergeleken met usb c stekkers.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 28 July 2021

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Dopo aver avuto una brutta esperienza durata fin troppo con le precedenti cuffie da me acquistate, ho acquistato queste Corsair Void Pro in edizione speciale di colore giallo, in occasione di un'offerta lampo di Amazon.Ordinate ed arrivate nella stessa giornata ( Fantastico servizio Prime di Amazon ), queste cuffie, si trovano all'interno di una confezione sgargiante che mostra l'articolo acquistato e le sue caratteristiche.Al suo interno, una volta aperta la confezione, troviamo le cuffie avvolte da svariate pellicole di protezione e bloccate con un paio di lacci metallici plastificati.Al di sotto delle cuffie, troviamo la dotazione di questo modello che comprende :1) Un pratico manuale d'uso purtroppo non in lingua italiana ma in ogni caso abbastanza semplice per chi ha un minimo di conoscenza di base di inglese od in alternativa di : Francese, Tedesco, Spagnolo, Portoghese o Russo.Si, in effetti, l'italiano non sarebbe stato male vista la quantita' di lingue supportate.2) Un cavo USB > Micro Usb per ricaricare le cuffie.3) Una basetta con fondo gommato con prolunga USB per collegare la chiave WiFi al Pc in modo da posizionarla comodamente dove si vuole.4) Spugnetta antivento copri microfono.I cavi, presentano un buon design dei connettori anche se avrei preferito, al giorno d'oggi, vedere dei cavi con rivestimento in corda presenti anche su cuffie di fascia molto bassa.Passiamo alle cuffie che si presentano con un design futuristico ed un peso accettabile di circa 385 grammi.Una volta indossate, si puo' notare che non fanno molta presa sulla testa rimanendo poco serrate ed io mi sono sempre considerato uno dalla testa grande.Questo puo' essere considerato sia un pregio che un difetto.I pregio puo' essere il confort dopo lunghe sessioni di utilizzo, il difetto puo' essere quello dell'isolamento dai rumori esterni.I gamers, sono esigenti, vogliono tutto e non sono soddisfatti di nulla ma, anche ritrovandomi in questa categoria, con il tempo sono diventato piu' pragmatico e quindi sono per dire che non si puo' avere tutto ma l'importante e' avere un oggetto che esegua bene le sue funzioni principali.Nel caso di queste cuffie, per quanto mi riguarda, le funzioni principali sono :1) Qualita' dell'audio in entrata ed in uscita.2) Qualita' del WiFi.3) Durata della batteria.Dopo aver dato uno sguardo al manuale ed aver scaricato dal sito di Corsair il software di gestione, mi sono apprestato ad inserire la chiavetta WiFi sopra la sua basetta ed i drivers delle cuffie si sono installati automaticamente.Ovviamente, i drivers permettono di far funzionare le cuffie ma se vogliamo avere il totale controllo sul ns. nuovo acquisto, dovremo installare l'iCUE di Corsair che ci dara' accesso : ai settaggi per il 7.1, ad un equalizzatore, al controllo e gestione dell'illuminazione ed ad altre features dedicate alle Void Pro.Inserita la chiavetta, vengono installati rapidamente i drivers di gestione e le cuffie sono pronte all'uso.Anche senza iCUE il suono e' qualitativamente buono e potente.Installato iCUE...la storia cambia e quello che sembrava buono, diventa ottimo.iCUE, si presenta finalmente in italiano e con un'interfaccia semplice ma curata e dall'uso intuitivo.Essendo un software che permette di controllare piu' dispositivi, ha una schermata Home dove potremo scegliere il dispositivo da gestire.Cliccando sull'icona delle nostre Void Pro Wireless, entreremo nella pagina delle impostazione delle suddette potendo gestire gli innumerevoli effetti di illuminazione che vanno dal semplice lampeggio di un singolo colore alla modalita' arcobaleno.Il logo di Corsair presente su entrambi i padiglioni delle Void Pro si illuminera' in base alla nostra scelta.Ma potremo anche scegliere di non utilizzare l'illuminazione risparmiando alla batteria del lavoro extra e guadagnando una durata maggiore di utilizzo prima di dover ricaricare.Passando alle impostazioni dell'audio, troviamo 5 preset forniti dalla casa che vanno dalla valorizzazione dei bassi all'ottimizzazione per i film ma potremo creare altri profili a piacimento in modo da personalizzare la nostra esperienza con queste cuffie andando ad agire su un equalizzatore a 10 bande.Oltre a tutto cio', potremo scegliere se utilizzare la modalita' Stereo o Surround.All'attivazione delle suddette modalita' una voce ( Donna sexy ^_^ ) ci avvertira' del cambio di impostazione.Questo, avviene anche quando ruoteremo l'asta del microfono in posizione di utilizzo.La nostra amica, ci avvertira' dicendoci quando il microfono e' attivo o non attivo.Ho provato queste cuffie con un player audio con qualche mp3, ho visto spezzoni di film con un player video e le ho provate in game con un paio di titoli.Suonano bene, l'audio e' di buona qualita' ed il surround e' veramente piacevole laddove sia possibile sfruttarlo.Provate con un programma di chat vocale, risultano buone anche come qualita' della voce.Termino questa recensione parlando brevemente del WiFi.Ho avuto precedenti esperienze con cuffie da gaming WiFi ed ho patito non poco con i software di gestione.Con queste ho girato per tutta casa senza notare disconnessioni di alcun genere.Pro- Buona qualita' audio in entrata ed uscita.- Sono 7.1- Software di gestione completo ed intuitivo.- Un WiFi finalmente valido.- Isolamento discreto nonostante non siano serrate sulla testa.- Dotazione.Contro- Troppo poco serrate sulla testa.- Cavetteria non cordata.Come per altri articoli, mi riservo eventualmente di aggiornare tra un po' di tempo questa recensione anche per valutare la durata della batteria che ovviamente al momento non ho idea di quanto possa realmente durare.Al di la di questo, consiglio senza ombra di dubbio l'acquisto di questo articolo a chi cerca un prodotto con queste caratteristiche.

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Seit einigen Jahren schon bringt Corsair gute Komponenten auf den Markt.Auch die Corsair Void RGB Wireless und dessen Nachfolger, das Void Elite RGB Wireless.Diese Serie bietet einen sehr guten Tragekomfort wie ein sehr angenehmer Kopfbügel mit weicher Polsterung und gut ausgelegte, abnehmbare stoffüberzogene Ohrpolster.Der Sound ist bereits in den Standardeinstellungen sehr gut, kann jedoch über die Software (aktuell iCUE) an eigene Bedürfnisse angepasst werden.Auch die Gelenke und Verbindungen sind sehr stabil ausgelegt.Das Headset kann gleichermaßen komplett wireless oder mit angeschlossenen USB-Kabel genutzt werden.Nun zu den kleinen Schwächen (hier sollte Corsair noch dran arbeiten, dann wäre es perfekt):- die Akkulaufzeit ist auch bei abgeschalteter Beleuchtung und Stereo-Betrieb etwas kurz (wenn es gut läuft zwischen 6 und 12 Stunden, eher 6, dann ist Schluss). Zum Glück kann das Headset auch mit Kabel betrieben werden.- Der Anschluss für das USB-Kabel liegt etwas ungünstig (lehnt man sich nach links wenn man das Headset wegen leeren Akkus mal mit Kabel nutzen muss, drückt man unweigerlich gegen den Anschluss, was bei zu viel Druck zur Beschädigung des einzigen Ladeports führen kann).- Die Reichweite hängt stark davon ab, wo man den Dongle platziert (an einem USB-Port am PC hinten oder bei einem Monitor mit eher mittig dahinter liegenden Anschlüssen kann sehr störend wirken), ein kleiner Stand zur freien Platzierung des USB-Sticks mit USB-Kabel als beiliegendes Zubehör hätte bei dem Preis bereits dabei sein können.- Das Microfon nimmt einen relativ leise auf und (da per USB/Dongle verbunden) bietet es keine Microfon Boost Option. Also entweder ein stärkeres Microfon oder eine in die Software integrierte Boost-Möglichkeit bzw. die Option zum Pegel noch höher regeln könnte hier Abhilfe schaffen.Trotz der kleinen Schwächen ein zu empfehlendes Headset, ich liebe die Klangqualität und den Tragekomfort

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Dopo svariati anni di gaming, il precedente headset era arrivato alla sua fine. Ho deciso di riprendere lo stesso identico modello, in quanto mi sono trovato perfettamente. Cuffie comode, non eccessivamente pesanti, microfono buono e facilità di mutarlo semplicemente tirandolo su. Buona ergonomia ed in estate non ti scaldano eccesivamente con i padiglioni. La batteria dei miei due modelli sempre perfetta (anche dopo anni) e con ottima durata, quelle di un amico (prese usate come nuove) invece arrivate con un difetto, che le portava a scaricarsi repentinamente.Consigliatissime in ogni caso

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Premetto che ho acquistato queste cuffie in sconto per 65 euro. Constatato questo posso dire che per il prezzo pagato da me sono più che soddisfatto del mio acquisto. Alti davvero buoni, medi altrettanto se proprio dovessi dirgli qualcosa magari è sui bassi che pur non essendo male non sono troppo corposi. Suono pulito e microfono meglio della media. Soddisfatto per il mio acquisto e se comprate per un prezzo tra i 60 e gli 80 ne uscirete soddisfatto per l'acquisto. PS: Consiglio di scaricare il software iCUE per gestirle al meglio e selezionare i vari moduli delle cuffie.

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: While using the headset it sometimes has a glitching sound comming from it's speakers and when I replug the device in my pc it's gone. Not a big problem but it can be a bit annoying to do it. (This doesn't happen all the time)
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 14 March 2022

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Very clear sound and playback

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Corsair a name you associate well with gaming.Build: This headset is built to last. Plastic mold with metal swivel earcups and metal in the headband.Sound: The sound quality is insanely good. I hear everything clearly when playing all my favourite games. I also listen to music alot and these are also good for that. I would recommend downloading the software for some other options. The quality of the mic is is fantastic and it is Discord certified. No distortion or crackling.All the buttons are easy to access on the headset. Your mic mutes when when you lift it up and unites when pulled down.The headset is super comfy and feels so light when on the head. I game for hours at a time and it still feels as comfy. My ears sweat on my old headset but not on this.This headset is noted as being able to do PC and Console but you don't get the adaptor to do Console, that has to be bought separately (can be purchased on a ebay super cheap).I really love this headset and for £69.99 it was a steal.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 January 2020

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Per quel che ci faccio (ascoltare serie tv 😂) direi che vanno più che bene. Ho approfittato di un super sconto. Forse un po’ grandi per me.

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: I have been using this for over 6 months now and it has proved to be a really good purchase.Sound quality : Really good, I use the headphones a lot to listen to music and I've never heard any distortion, the low and high frequencies are apparent, I can't moan reallyComfort : I need to wear glasses so large headphones can cause me discomfort in a short time, however I can wear these headphones for hours while wearing my glasses without fear for them being damaged, Perfect! If I had a niggle it would be that if I rock back in my chair the headphones can move, due to the weight I think, but i guess that is the price for having long life batteries in themMicrophone :  Difficult to comment here as I haven't really used them in anger, what I have noticed though is that the quality largely depends on the applications you use, e.g. using Discord gives you good consistent quality, Battle net will turn you into a Darlek if you raise your voice.Battery Life : Good, Batteries last a long time (5 hours I think) but not  as long as the box says they will.  The other thing is that it takes an age to fully charge them, and recommends that once charged the cable should be disconnected promptly afterwards (probably to preserve the overall life of the battery).  However the charge indicator light is effectively underneath the headphones if you use the stand which makes it awkward to check and to be realistic you are likely to charge them over night which could mean overcharging them for several hours if you're like me.  Make sure you have a USB-3 charger/hub to charge these with as it will dramatically reduce the charge time.  Trust me, a standard USB charger will take 24+ hours to charge them up.  I nearly sent them back when I first got them because it took 3 days to initially top them up.  However, on the plus side, you can use them while they are charging and the cable is unobtrusive and longNiggles : Because the headphones are bluetooth, you have to go through the Windows system settings to change the default audio output device.  This is really annoying and on older OS's has a tenancy to be either buried or inaccessible.  It would be really useful if Corsair built a menu option in there quick access app to allow changing of the default Audio output, otherwise download "Audio Switch" which isn't perfect but helps a lotPros:* Great sound quality* Great comfort (even with glasses)* Great battery life* Microphone is convenient, (quality depends on software used)Cons:* Battery charging time, Invest in a USB-3 charger/hub (seriously)* Can slide of your head if you tilt your head* Switching between speakers and headphone use though windows
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 December 2018

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White

Review: nice quality product
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United States on 4 May 2021

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: I bought a SteelSeries headset for Zoom and Teams on the advice of my Gamer son. I liked it and the wireless system works well - even though it uses USB-C and I had to buy an adapter.What’s that got to do with the Corsair? Well, when lockdown 3 started and schools went online, my 12 year old daughter needed a headset, so I gave her that SS set.This meant that I was back on a search for another set - and I thought ‘do I buy another SS set or buy what my son uses - a Corsair Gaming set?’ I researched, read up and looked around and came to the same conclusion that my son had - that these are very good value for money.For music I only use Bose as they suit my music choices, fit very well and sound superb. Yes they’re expensive but they are, for me, the best.When reading about these Corsairs, I saw posts that the fit isn’t great and the sound is not always what is expected. Now my online headphone requirements are modest; I’m no gamer but I am a songwriter and collaborate with my music partner regularly.These fit me nicely, the sound is great and I love the Mic which when you flip it up, turns the mic off. The American voice that states ‘Mic on / Mic off’ is annoying and perhaps you can turn it off - the software ‘iCue’ is easy to use and can control a host of other Corsair gadgets.My main gripe is the size of the USB Dongle - it’s the same size as an old thumb drive and could be damaged fairly easily. Unlike the SS version which is a lot smaller (but I accept that brings other issues).For the price I paid; this set is comfortable, very configurable (the lights on the sides of the headphone cup can be altered to your own taste like a lot of Corsair products), the mic flips up out of the way (and is turned off when in that position) and the overall sound of the set is very pleasing.You can adjust the sound to a variety of settings and although I’ve not played with that much, it does make a noticeable difference if you like that sort of thing and could enhance games.I’m very pleased with them and would recommend them.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 February 2021

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: 音や使い心地は特に問題なく、むしろ快適です。ゲームでの使用感も良好でマイクもメンバーから特に文句を言われません。問題は充電ケーブル(付属)を刺しているにもかかわらず首を動かしただけで充電が止まったりすることと、左側のマイクや充電ケーブル接続端子(USB2.0 micro-B)がある方から「カタカタ」と、中で何かがガタついているような音が聞こえる点です。右側も変な音が鳴っていましたが、原因がパッドと本体の間に黒いネジが一本挟まって居たといういたって簡単なことだったので取り出してからは特に問題はありません。はずれを引いたのかもしれませんが、ほかの方もご注意ください。

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Valgono quello che costano, sono riuscito a prenderle a 90 euro invece che 110 e posso dire con estrema facilità che sono le migliori che abbia mai provato.Comodità davvero elevata, quasi te le scordi addosso, spesso mi capita di andare in giro per casa con le cuffie senza rendermene conto, ovviamente regolabili a seconda della vostra dimensione, con cuscinetti in tessuto traspirante, perfette per l'estate.Per quanto riguarda la batteria, non sono sicuro siano 16 ore di autonomia, forse qualcosa in più addirittura.Per adesso mi sono trovato molto bene, l'audio è veramente molto buono, pecca un po' sulla nitidezza della voce, ma per il resto davvero una bomba.Microfono ok, funziona correttamente, può essere spento da un pulsante direttamente sulla cuffia sx oppure con la funzione "Flip to mute" ed in più il microfono si illumina di rosso per farti capire che è spento.se volete delle cuffie che valgano tutti i soldi spesi, vi consiglio queste.

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: First off I love how comfortable and quality this headset is, it's adjustable on the band and the two headphones. My friends say the mic sounds great, it's clear and with noise cancellation from outside sources.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 December 2023

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Scrivo questa recensione dopo oltre un mese di utilizzo. Ottime cuffie con padiglioni larghi che risultano molto comode e non troppo pesanti. L'arco che poggia sulla testa è rivestito di un tessuto imbottito e morbido che da una bella sensazione. Il microfono funziona perfettamente, non provocando rumori e fruscii (chiesto a più persone in conferenza). Dotate di un controllo del volume con levetta sul padiglione sinistro, che funge anche da bottone per attivare/disattivare il 5.1 (la differenza si sente anche se non è estrema).Possibilità di personalizzare i led sui padiglioni sia con colori che con movimenti diversi degli stessi, grazie al programma scaricabile dal sito del produttore, insieme a qualche altra opzione come per esempio l'inibizione dei rumori e suoni provenienti lateralmente al microfono.Inizialmente ho avuto dei problemi, poi risolti agevolmente: quando le cuffie erano attaccate sul retro del case a volte windows non eseguiva il boot, basta comunque non collegarle alle prime usb in alto della scheda madre o comunque disabilitando l'usb legacy dal bios.In sostanza ottime cuffie, suono chiaro e bella anche la confezione (in essa è presente anche una spugnetta per ricoprire il microfono). Ovviamente arrivate in men che non si dica grazie ad Amazon.

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Cuffie per pc e console, le cuffie hanno un bel design e sono comode anche se non isolano dai rumori e non riesci ad immergerti nel gioco..I controlli sui padiglioni sono comodissimi infatti dopo poche ore di utilizzo già si trova la posizione dei tasti facilmente.. nella scatola possiamo trovare cuffie, cavo jack da 3,5 e la scheda audio per collegare le cuffie al pc. Qualità dell’audio molto buona su pc con il 7.1 virtuale tramite il programma di corsair, ovviamente su console il 7.1 non funziona, però comunque anche su console la qualità dell’audio audio è buona, sentirete facilmente i passi dei nemici negli fps per esempio.Il microfono funziona molto bene, uso spesso la chat vocale con amici e mi sentono molto bene mai avuto problemi.. unica pecca è la qualità costruttiva che non è delle migliori..Comunque cuffie consigliate per chi usa sia pc che console e vuole avere solo un paio di cuffie che funzioni bene in entrambe le piattaforme..

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: I have bought multiple pairs of these… they work for a month or two then they wont charge and they ate useless. What the heck 160 dollars and it works for a month??? And no return option, crap!
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United States on 28 July 2023

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: The audio quality is good, easy to set different profiles with iCue on your computer, but there are two major defects: battery duration, and the headset feels heavy.I end up charging the headset every very few days of use, and the cable provided with the headset itself wasn't working properly either, so I had to buy a new one myself.Also, the headset feels heavy on the head after a few hours, hurting a little bit.Overall, 4 stars, bought it on sale, I would have rather bought wired headset at this point, maybe, but it's still quiet okay.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the Netherlands on 10 September 2023

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Cuffie molto belle e dalla costruzione particolarmente solida. Software di gestione completo, che permette di rilanciare la propria voce in cuffia, funzione molto comoda perché l'isolamento con l'esterno è estremo e risentire la propria voce è altresì gradevole. Molto belli i materiali, un po' caldo il materiale spugnoso delle cuffie che è rivestito di tessuto ma calza perfettamente all'esterno dei padiglioni auricolari. Ottimo il volume, che risulta già molto alto all'80% della regolazione. Il microfono ritorna una voce con frequenze molto fedeli e incorpora l'automatismo di auto spegnimento alla rotazione dell'archetto verso l'alto. In sostanza un ottimo ottimo prodotto, leggermente caro visti i prodotti della concorrenza.

ProductName: CORSAIR Void RGB Elite Wireless Gaming Headset – 7.1 Surround Sound – Omni-Directional Microphone – Microfiber Mesh Earpads – Up to 40ft Range – iCUE Compatible – PC, Mac, PS5, PS4 – White
Review: Bought this around a week ago now. It's an excellent headset.This is the 2017 version with the upgraded mic.The headset itself is made from a high quality plastic and metal frame, around the ears and head band there is a perforated foam which s extremely comfortable.Located on the left ear cup is also a mute button for the mic.Sound quality is very good for the headset although it does lack some low end bass during scenes with explosions, in the detailed sections of audio is where the headset really stands out, YouCan here with pin point accuracy where an enemy is located.Overall I'm very pleased with the headset and would definitely recommend.If you appreciated this review then please click the helpful button, it allows us to keep reviewing products like this for you.

Review: Muy buen sonido y calidad de materiales teniendo en cuenta el precio.Si los usaras para gaming y música como es mi caso sin duda completamente recomendable.

ProductName: Turtle Beach Recon 70 Blue Camo Gaming Headset for Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, & Xbox One, Playstation 5, PS4, Nintendo Switch, Mobile, & PC with 3.5mm Connection
Review: I don’t normally write reviews for products but these headphones are pretty dope. These are my first pair of gaming headphones so I’m no connoisseur by any stretch.. but I saw some mixed reviews on these which lowkey made me hesitant to purchase so thought I’d chime in. Personally, I’d recommend them. They work just fine and the sound is pretty great. For the price I wasn’t expecting BOSE or anything but definitely exceeded my expectations. I’m really into the depth of the base and these definitely do the trick. The volume switch is also on the back of the left headphone so maybe those who say the volume doesn’t work after a few days just need to turn that up? Idk. Overall I’m pretty happy with these. I play fortnite on my switch usually and sometimes I can’t tell if the sounds are from the game or outside my house.. that’s how decent these headphones are. Got the navy camo, they look so good. 5 stars.

Review: Decent sound quality and fairly comfortable, don't really use the mic but I believe it's ok quality. Not bad for the price, used everyday and still work and no problems with them yet.

Review: Amazing for what the price is. Good audio for both gaming and viewing. Deep base, quality sound. The headphones do a good job of drowning out background sound but not fully noise canceling. Same with the mic it picks up what’s close and does well but not great at drowning out background noise. Strongly recommend for the price.

ProductName: Turtle Beach Recon 70 Blue Camo Gaming Headset for Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, & Xbox One, Playstation 5, PS4, Nintendo Switch, Mobile, & PC with 3.5mm Connection
Review: I bought these after thoroughly ready many of remarks.Wish the sound was higher. Even with the volume turned up all the way ( on the left side of the headphones ) you can still hear things around you.These are amazing ! Noise cancelling is great. ! Just enough bass. My husband games more than me and wants more volume out of them. But I find them just fine.  I don’t know why guys need it that loud. It has very good directional sound too while shooting and listening for things coming up our left and right.I would buy these again for sure ! Even though the sound could be louder for my husband. I think they ar great !Super comfy on BOTH our heads !

Review: Natürlich steht hier die frage im raum was man für 30 euro erwarten kann… naja ich hab schon echt gute over ear Kopfhörer für solches geld gehabt, nur halt ohne mikro. Kuckt mal bei thomann.Zum positiven, funktioniert an der xbox ohne setup oder so. Reinstecken und fertig.Da hört es leider schon aufDas headset wirkt recht klapprig, es ist irgendwie komisch geformt, der bügel fällt so nach vorne, ich verstehe dieses design nicht.Tragekomfort… naja. Man kanns tragen, komfortabel ist das aber eigentlich nichtder sound ist OKAY, aber manchmal knistert, kratzt, rauscht es. Das habe ich bei meinen anderen kopfhörern nicht.Zum micro, es scheint zu funktionieren, aber der sound beim gegenüber ist wohl nicht gerade überragend.Alles in allem… vermutlich muss ich mir eine andere lösung ausdenken, da das mit diesem teil einfach unbefriedigend ist.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: My 16 year old loves them- easily the best headset he’s ever had and he’s had plenty. Wireless is efficient and faultless. Clear and stylish - happy customers!

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: The EPOS H3PRO Hybrid is the premium wireless headphone I have always been looking for. Essentially, just think of it as the Steelseries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless but without the external DAC. After around 4 month of using this headphone, I can say that it has brought me immense satisfaction.Everything about this headphone is just exactly perfect. Some people might say the volume wheel is trash but it just really adjust the volume based on each level of sound that can be offered to you by your laptop. If you didn't get that, what I tried to say is that there is nothing wrong with the headphone.For the ANC, it isn't ridiculously powerful but it definitely makes an impact. When you turn the ANC on, your sound will sound more close to you (rather than more spatial without the ANC). This isn't a downside by any means. It really is just a preference.The only downside of this headphone and it isn't a life changer either, is that you can't pause, skip forward/backward with buttons on this headphone. I hope they roll out an update that allows you to do this on the headphone itself.I bought this during a discount and I can say that I am extremely happy with it. It is still well worth your money if it doesn't offer a discount though.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Pro's:The sound is warm and the application for windows is simple.Connectivity with Dongle and Bluetooth is flawlessCons:Bluetooth connectivity to windows offers no customization to the sound in app leaving a flat experience.You can only have a single Bluetooth device bound at once so if on console, using the 2.5mm jack is the only option to have both phone and console connected and even then it is a bit buggy.Around there bottom of the ears there is a lot of noise bleed from outside as the is little to no pressure placed on my ears from the headband. If you push the headband back to just on your crown it seals much better but feels a little awkward when looking down like it is about to slide off again.The ANC is a lacklustre feature due to the noise bleed and adds nothing to immersion.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Terrible. Intermittent distortion as long as the headset remains within 5 meters of the dongle. Beyond that, the signal drops out entirely. My previous senheisers had enough range to wander around the room. These are a serious downgrade. Will be returning.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Great sound, long lasting battery, USB c, Hi-fi audio, multiple connection options, removable mic, light weight and extremely comfortable. The best wireless gaming headset you can get today.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: So i got the headset and initial experience was great - the sound quality was good to great (I see a lot of people complaining about lack of bass - i also found this to be the case unless anc was turned on for some reason? either an eq thing while anc is on, or a "seal" problem perhaps?)Either way, used them with anc on almost exclusively and they sound great. No issues with connection (via the dongle or bluetooth, bluetooth has some latency but the dongle does not, was impressed)A couple months down the line though the microphone started to crackle/pop when moved (sounded like when turning a volume knob with a dirty pot or something). This noise was actually picked up by the mic itself, and also only audible to the user with sidetone turned on. This got worse and worse, eventually the mic stopped working completely when it was fully extended. I had to use the mic at a slightly higher angle than ideal for it to even function.I contacted EPOS support who went through the usual pointless spiel of making sure my software was updated, even though i'd said multiple times it seems like a hardware thing. Each message took them 2-3 days to respond and they just came back with more and more questions, including multiple screenshots of the epos software running on my pc. They then asked for a recording of the noise itsef. By this time i'd given up waiting for their support to respond and just returned it to Amazon. At least Amazon respond in a useful and timely manner most of the time

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Just to be aware, the software suite does not appear to work on Windows 11 - great sound out of the box tho

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Acheté après avoir testé le Steelseries Arctis nova pro wireless , la qualité du son est pareil, l'Epos est plus confortable et n'a pas les micros de l'ANC qui rentre dans l'oreille comme le Steeleries. Seul la réduction du bruit active est un peu moins bonne que sur le Steelseries mais entre 380€ et 200€ il n'y a pas photo. Pour le reste je n'ai pas de problème de latence comme j'ai vu sur certains commentaires ou de micro qui grésille quand on le relève. On peut facilement enlever le mode veille automatique dans le logiciel pour info.En bref pour 200€ vous ne trouverez pas mieux.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 November 2022

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: + lässt sich mit allem verbinden was audio ausgibt im wesentlichen+ Wechselt nicht zwischen den Quellen sondern verbindet sich mit mehreren gleichzeitig (dadurch gibt's keine Unterbrechungen)+ Man kann aufladen und hören über USB gleichzeitig (können seltsamerweise viele Headset nicht)+ Akkulaufzeit ist sehr gut muss es selten aufladen und benutze es fast dauernd+ ANC funktioniert ganz gut und verbraucht jetzt nicht sehr viel mehr Strom find ich+ Selbst nach stundenlangen tragen nicht unangenehm- Wenn man USB und dongle am PC angesteckt hat kommt es öfter durcheinander was jetzt die Quelle jeweils ist- Dieses seltsame krachen kommt immer noch vor (also selbst nach den vielen Firmware Updates) was andere Käufer bemängelt haben, aber das ist 0,1% der Zeit und 99,9% der Zeit läuft es einwandfrei- Nervt manchmal mit dem "Fully charged" das es dir ins Ohr brüllt wenn du mit USB verbunden bist und auflädst und hörst gleichzeitig

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: こちらは ANC (アクティブノイズキャンセリング)対応のワイヤレスヘッドホンとしての機能もあるし、スマホと Bluetooth接続しながら、PCゲームの音も同時に再生するというボイスチャット対応のゲーミングヘッドホンならではの側面も持ち合わせています。なので、いつもの自分のオーディオ部分に対する評価だけじゃないところを踏まえつつ、なのですが、やっぱりオーディオメインで評価します。マイクのゲインとか、音質などはしっかり評価してくれる相手がおらず…、この２か月間でチャットしたり、電話会議用に使った相手から悪い評価をもらっていないというレベルで、◎ と解釈しています。また、Bluetoothヘッドセットの場合、結構屋外での利用で、風切り音なども評価の対象としているのですが、こちらの製品は大きさや利用用途から、ほとんど自宅やオフィスだろうと解釈して、屋外での使用の評価はしませんでした。ANC対応のワイヤレスヘッドホンとしては、EPOSの前身となっているゼンハイザーらしさは感じられます。Apple はもとより、Boseの QuietComfort よりも密閉度が高く、ソニーの WH-1000MX3 よりもすっぽり耳を隠してくれる感じです。結果として、ノイズキャンセリングされにくい、人の声やテレビの音みたいな部分もかなり減衰してくれるため、かなり音にフォーカスできます。エアコンの音を消すのは朝飯前で、ゲーミングパソコンのファンノイズもまったく気にならないレベル。冬特有のものとしては加湿器の動作音なども、気になりません。これまで自分が愛用してきた ANC対応のオーバーイヤー型のヘッドホンとは、また違った味付けですが、ノイズキャンセリング力は強いと思いました。このANC力が強い前提なのでしょうが、非常に素直な音がします。音楽を聴いても、変にブーストしたりせずに、繊細な音を繊細なまま。低音も素直になっているまま再生してくれる感じです。密閉ゆえの圧迫感はありますが、音自体は、Bose のマルチメディアスピーカーなどで聴いているのと同じような音域です。詳細は下記にまとめましたので、参考になれば幸いです。1.まとめ-------1) ノイズキャンセリング性能　WH-1000MX3 ＝＞ Bose QuietComfort 25 ＝ EPOS H3 PRO Hybrid2) 音の繊細さ　EPOS H3 PRO Hybrid　＝　WH-1000MX3　＝＞　Bose QuietComfort 253) 低音　ほとんど差がない。強いて言えば Bose QC-25が強いかも。4) マイクの聞きやすさ　差なし価格帯はほぼ同じ 3万円前後の製品となっていて、ヘッドホンとしての再生性能は多少の個性もあれど、どれも高品位で、気持ちよく聴くことができます。差分もほぼ個性の範囲です。これに加えて、EPOS H3 PRO Hybrid はマルチな入力や、USB接続により低遅延接続などに対応しているという点が特徴と言えるでしょう。2.ノイズキャンセリング-------ノイズキャンセリング性能は、ゲーミングヘッドホンだからか、パソコンのファンノイズみたいなものや、キータッチ音みたいなところがほぼほぼ消えます。ただ、3万円クラスのヘッドホンなので、ライバルもみな同レベルで消えることを考えると、ノイズキャンセリング性能には差がないというべきだと感じました。前述のとおり、ヘッドホンとしての密閉度が高いです。このため高音域のノイズもほとんど気にならないのは特徴です。特に Bose QC-25 は、家の前の公園で赤ちゃんが大声で泣いていると、それが聞こえますが、こちらは良くも悪くもほとんど聞こえません。ものすごく遠くで泣いている感じに聴こえます。3.音の繊細さ、低音性能-------ノイズキャンセリングした状態では中低音が結構効いた感じの音です。高音の伸びはあんまり感じられませんでした。書斎の静かな環境でもそうなんで、この辺は H3 PRO Hybrid のドライバの特性もあるかもしれません。自分はクラシック、ピアノ曲、女性ボーカル曲が多いのですが、モニタスピーカーとほぼ同じ印象です。高音が少し伸び悩むくらい。一方で、ゲームなどに特有の環境音 (足音や近くに敵が来た音) などは、きちんと方向感もわかる感じで伝わってくるところがすごいなと感じます。この辺は、ソニーも Bose も、意外と丸めちゃっているところがあるので、音の定位をしっかり保つところは、考えられていると感じました。(参考) 自分評価のノイズキャンセリングの効き具合WH-1000MX3 ★★★★★★★★★★(10)Bose QC-35 　★★★★★★★★★(9)EPOS H3 Pro　★★★★★★★★★(9) <<= ここ※ 遮音性で優位性ありBose QC-25 　★★★★★★★★★(9)AirPods Pro 　 ★★★★★★★★(8)WF-1000MX3 　　★★★★★★★★(8) *条件ありATH-ANC300TW  ★★★★★★★★(7)AVOPT TE=D01t  ★★★★★★★★(7)GLIDiC TW-6100 ★★★★★★★★(7)WI-SP600N 　 ★★★★(3) *条件あり一般的なカナル型 ★(1)購入のご参考になりましたら幸いです。

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Alcune premesse:Io vengo da un paio di Hyperx Cloud Alfa cablate ed uno di Steelseries Arctis 9.Posseggo queste cuffie da una settimana  ed ho avuto modo di provarle e farmene un'idea. La sessione di utilizzo più lunga è stata di 4 ore. Da quando le utilizzo non ho ancora avuto bisogno di caricarle ed hanno circa il  70% di batteria residua.Cercherò di essere sintetico per evitare una recensione noiosa.PRO:1)Hanno un audio in cuffia molto buono. Voto 8,52) Il microfono funziona discretamente bene, chi mi sente dice che la mia voce ha una tonalità "giusta" e che mi capiscono sempre molto bene. Voto 8.3) Sono molto comode, dopo 4 ore che le indosso non danno nessun fastidio. Voto 9.4) Si possono connettere a tutto e hanno una connessione molto stabile e veloce, sia cablate che wireless. Voto 10.5) la batteria è decisamente sopra la media tra le migliori cuffie gaming. Voto 9.6) hanno un'estetica particolare, ma sono comunque eleganti, si possono usare anche in strada o a lavoro senza sfigurare. Si fanno notare senza essere appariscenti. Voto 8.7) Riduzione attiva dei rumori ambientali che funziona egregiamente, ma è pensata espressamente per abbattere il rumore delle ventole di raffreddamento di un pc, se usato per annullare i rumori di una strada affollata, è poco efficace. Voto 7.CONTRO:1) Costano tanto. Voto 4 e 1/2.In conclusione sono cuffie che non eccellono in nulla, ma il loro punto di forza è la versatilità. Sono ottime per il gaming, per il lavoro, per la mobilità (hanno il microfono esterno che si stacca e riattacca con un meccanismo magnetico) e vanno bene per ascoltare film e musica con un'ottima qualità audio, collegate al telefono permettono anche di telefonare senza problemi, (hanno anche un secondo piccolo microfono integrato) e poi sono dotate anche di riduzione attiva del rumore ambientale!

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Even though I paid for a *new* product, I received the headset in used condition. The manual was folded against the creases, nothing was wrapped in plastic, and there were several accessories un-banded. Regardless, I was anxious to see if the headset would work so I plugged in the USB dongle and started setting it up in Windows 11 Pro.I immediately ran into issues connecting to the EPOS Gaming Suite software, but I expected as much, based on the reviews. Plus, I own an older Sennheiser Game One headset with driver issues (Sennheiser and EPOS gaming headsets used to be the same brand).The driver issues with this headset are pretty much the same as my older headset. You can get audio to come through fine with plug and play (legacy drivers) but if you want to connect to the EPOS Gaming Suite, you’ll need their proper drivers. It’s also worth noting that the EPOS Gaming Suite software worked when I connected the included USB-A to USB-C cable to the headset… but who wants to use a cord with a wireless headset?So, I needed to get the USB dongle working or I was going to return the headset. I screwed around for a couple hours updating firmware, uninstalling/reinstalling drivers and software, until I was about ready to print the return labels. Then finally I made one simple change, and everything worked. I went to Device Manager -> Audio Inputs and Outputs -> Headset (EPOS H3PRO Dongle) -> Update Driver.Boom. Everything worked.I admit this hassle isn’t ideal for the average consumer; however, I’m glad I stuck with it and got it working. As far as the actual hardware is concerned, I'm totally satisfied. It sounds and feels better than my old headset. It has a snug fit that only slips when you tilt your head too far forward. The ear cups are firm, but cushioned, and do well to form a good seal. The volume limit could stand to be a little louder, but the clarity is very good. You aren't going to get thumping bass or anything, but frequencies are well separated and clear. The software also has an equalizer to play with. There are 2 surround modes - 2.0 does well for louder stereo music, and 7.1 is good for most games/movies. The noise cancelling is kind of strange as it only seems to cancel lows - like the sound of my voice, but it’s not bad. The wireless aspect is amazing and battery life is an absolute non-issue. I plug it in whenever I’m done using it (usually 14-hour sessions), and I’ve never had it reach less than 60% charge. You can also attach it to the USB-A to USB-C cable which is about 6 feet long if the battery dies. I haven't used Bluetooth so I can't comment on that.Overall, the hardware is great, the software isn't bad, and the driver support is lacking. If you use the USB dongle like me, just update the drivers in Windows and you should be good to go.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: So after a lot of researching for a good set of wireless headphones, i finally settled on these.  I've been using them for about a day and this is what i've found so far using them.The Good.They're comfy to wear.  Haven't done any super long sessions with them yet, but i didn't feel like my head was in a vice. I've got a big head, so that's a winner in my books.  Also you can wear them with glasses and not feel like they're trying to push them through your head.The build quality so far looks and feels solid.  They look premium and feel it too, which is what you want when you're about to spend this kind of money.  The ear cups feel good and didn't noticeably make my head feel warm or hot.  Not sure how that will be in the summer though.The sound quality is good.  These are primarily aimed at gamers and not audiophiles.  The sound definitely focuses more around the bass.  If you like that kind of sound profile like me, i feel you will like these.  Again, they were good for watching movies, and were ok for music.  Comparing them to my Sony WH-1000XM3, you're going to notice the difference.  However, i didn't buy these for the reason of listening to music, i bought them for gaming.Battery life, so far it's pretty good.  If you're in a long session and run out of battery you can plug them in via the USB C connector to your PC and carry on, just like if they were wired.  However, i haven't tested this in anger to see if what EPOS claims is true.I love the detachable mic.  It's one of the main reasons i went with these.  I have a desk mic, so wasn't fussed about the microphone.  So i can't comment if the quality of the mic is any good.Connecting them to my PC was super simple.  Honestly, plug the dongle in and turn them on.  Let the PC do the rest.  That simple.Now for the OKThe desktop software is not great and is by far my biggest issue.  There's is a huge amount of room for improvement here.  This is what i have found so far.It feels a strange mix between keeping things simple, and not providing enough to actually use it properly.I found it took a little while for it to realise you have the headphones wireless connected.  And when it does connect, i found it forget my previous configuration.  For example, if you had them configured for mode 2.0 and then shut down your PC.  When you next load it up, the mode will be back to 7.1.  This gets tiring pretty quickly.  We'll call this a bug (feature) for now.As mentioned above, I've noticed when plugging them in and going back to wireless there is a lag in the software.  There isn't in the headphones, it's instant.  Which is good, but again points to another bug potentially.You can only tell how much battery life is left from the desktop app when you're using the dongle it seems.  Not a huge issue, but it would be better if you could tap the power button and it told you.  Further to that, when you turn them on it does tell you the battery life.  However, if you have 100% battery, it will tell you you have more than 80% battery left.  I found this pretty annoying, as i want to be specific.You can only access the troubleshooting option from the system try EPOS icon by right clicking on it.  Not from the main app, which means it could easily be overlooked.  Even then, the troubleshooting guide seems separate as it listed a completely different model of headphone.The volume wheel doesn't feel as good as my previous Sennheiser wired headset.  It's an infinite rotation, so no min or max to it.  However, it just doesn't feel as smooth to me.  Which if i'm honest, i'll use very little as my keyboard has a great volume wheel on it and i use that already.The ANC just feels not good at all.  Honestly, i couldn't tell the difference when it was on and when it was off.  It definitely didn't block out the sound of my typing when it was on.  Also, It's either on or off, there's no ANC profiles so you can configure how sensitive you want the ANC to be.  When it is on though i found you got this strange white noise background.  Which was just annoying.  If you want ANC, i would say don't get these for that reason.Some nit picking issues.There's no L and R markings on them.  This isn't a problem when the microphone is connected, but when it's removed, i've found myself checking which way round they should be before putting them on.  This will obviously fade with time as i get used to them.The box they came in didn't exactly scream premium.  An odd thing to pick up on i know, but if you're about to drop this kind of money on some gaming headphones you want the full experience right?ConclusionAm i happy i got them?  Yes, definitely, they're good wireless gaming headphones.  The main issues i have with them are things which can be fixed through updates.  I got these for gaming and watching the odd TV/Film on my PC.  I'm not about to go and listen to my music collection with these, as there are better options when it comes to that.As you can tell my main issue with them so far is the desktop software.  EPOS really need to step it up here, as it letting down a good product.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Je déconseille fortement surtout a se prix beaucoup de points négatif il y’a plusieurs soucis utilisation majoritairement sur ps5 les problèmes c’est que ya des coupures de son pendant la partie pareil pour le Bluetooth surtout si on connecte simultanément a la play et un téléphone iphone 13 pro max pour mon cas donc tel récent il ya des crépitements a certains moments, la réduction de bruit est quasi inexistante, le son du Micro est bon on est bien entendu le son est bon aussi les aigus lés détail les basses sont bonne dommage si il ya des crépitements et des coupures sa gâche tout le Bluetooth au téléphone se coupe a des moments aussi et il ya un gros décalage  j’attendais beaucoup de se casque il ya que le design et la finition qui sont top l’un des plus beau mais sa fais pas tout j’ai tester énormément de casque pour ps5 razer kaira pro, corsair hs80, le nouveau sony inzone h9, le nouveau steelseries nova pro, steelseries arctis 7p+, astro a50, audeze penrose, le bang olufsen portal ps, et d’autre model autant dire j’ai eu beaucoup de casque cher je peux donner un avis majoritairement les tests et avis sont sur pc je donne mon avis sur tout ses casque sur ps5  je conseil fortement audeze penrose qui pour moi et le meilleur casque audio de tous avec quelques défauts confort moyen autonomie faible par rapport a la moyenne mais le meilleur en son aussi il ya le steelseries nova pro que je trouve le deuxième meilleur selon mon comparatif pour la play je précise voilà pour mon avis personnel si sa peut aider certains qui cherche le meilleur son détailler le mieux spacialisé 3d pour la play
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United States on 21 April 2023

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Ce casque EPOS H3Pro Hybrid arrive dans une simple boite en carton noir, dans laquelle on trouvera le casque avec ses divers câblesEt notices en images et texte.Je vous le dit de suite, le dongle Bluetooth usb est branché sur le câble USB, cela vous évitera de le chercher partout comme moi, surtout qu'il est très petit.Le casque este très qualitatif et le choix des matières judicieux, il est assez léger et confortable, surtout sur de longues périodes de port.Il risque de l'être un peu moins en été si il fait chaud, mais c'est le cas de tout les casques.Il est compatible avec le port de lunettes.Les cache oreilles sont très agréable et assure déjà une réduction de bruit à elle seule,qui pourra être renforcé par celle que propose l'électronique du casque (assez efficace)Niveau connectivité, c'est la fête !Bluetooth, USB, filaire mini jack et même sans fil USB via le dongle fournie (souvenez vous, celui qui se cache :)Ayant testé les 4 modes sur divers appareil, aucun soucis à noter.L'autonomie et correcte et me convient parfaitement. Le réglage du son se fait via une molette sur le côté droit et on a au total 3 boutonsOn/off, bluetooth et marche/arrêt réduction de bruit.Concernant la restitution sonore, mon avis est celui dun utilisateur lambda, qui écoute de tout, donc je serais probablement moins sévère qu'un audiophile ou un mélomane.Que se soit pour l'écoute de musique, la bande son des films ou encore les appels téléphoniques tout est reproduit avec fidélité et qualité.Sa principale utilisation étant pour moi le jeu vidéo, il est parfait, sa réduction de bruit est un plus et le dongle usb fonctionne parfaitement sur PS4, et personnellement j'apprécie son côté très sobre ce qui est assez rare chez les casques de gaming.Le micro se coupe facilement en remontant le bras à la verticale (qui est optionnel et amovible)Ce casque aura été pour moi une belle découverte, d'une bonne qualité, le prix est cependant très élevé (279€) et à ce tarif, le casque pourrait au moins être accompagné d'un sac de rangement.Merci de m'avoir lu, si mon commentaire, mes photos vous ont été utiles, un petit clic est toujours appréciable pour moi :)
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 December 2021

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Ich habe ein Sennheiser 560s (Kopfhörer) zusammen mit einem Arc MK2 (DAC/Verstärker)Was zusammen ein super Setup für Spiele ist und ich eigentlich sehr zufrieden bin damit.Dennoch wollte Ich dem EPOS H3Pro Hybrid eine chance geben da es im gegensatz zu seinen vorgängern mit einer 2.4 GHz Dongle (30ms Latenz gemessen)  ausgestattet ist und im gegensatz zu meinem Setup halt eben Kabellos ist.Das Headset ist qualitativ für gaming Headsets gut, jedoch nich für den Preis.Bügel mit komischen Stoff überzogen, Lautstärke Drehrad schrecklich, Mikrofon naja, aber ich möchte hier gar nicht gross auf das eingehen.Sound ist dank der Software individuell mit Profilen einstellbar und funktioniert auch gut.Das Headset macht alles was es soll ganz anständig, der Sound ist dank der EPOS Software individuell einstellbar und funktioniert auch.Jetz zum grossen no-go und was mitunter auch der Grund ist wieso ich es zurück gebe.Wenn man das Headset abschaltet wechselt Windows nicht automatisch auf deine Lautsprecher was halt einfach sehr sehr sehr schlecht ist und im 2022 einfach nicht mehr akzeptabel ist.Mir ist klar das solche Probleme mit Firmware Updates zu beheben sind, die Frage ist nur wann und ob. Sehr schaade den dass Headset und die Software dazu sind eigentlich ganz gut, nur muss das ganze muss halt eben auch mit Windows funktionieren. Wichtig zu erwähnen ist auch dass ich von der 2.4 GHz Verbindung am PC spreche und nicht von 3.5mm TRS oder Bluetooth.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Só falta suportar múltiplos dispositivos em simultâneo por bluetooth.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Dopo svariate video recensioni e recensioni scritte mi sono convinto a prendere le H3 pro hybrid, che dire, scelta piu azzeccata nn potevo farla. Collegamento alla ps5 tramite Dongle è perfetto, collegamento alla tv tramite bluetooth perfetto, suono cristallino, tramite software da scaricare su pc si possono cambiare svariati settaggi. Consigliatissime!!! E poi ricordatevi, dietro c è Sennheiser.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: sonido bien, accesorios bien, pero si tienes una cabeza grande tal vez busca otra opcion

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Great audio quality, but the earphone arm snapped after six months making them useless. EPOS initially refused to replace it saying it was my fault, but came back later and admitted that was a mistake. They sent me a brand new headset.Pros:Great sound qualityComfortableGood noise cancellingLong battery lifeCons:Temperamental bluetooth that keeps needing to be unplugged to connect to PC.Poor range - starts breaking up after a 1-2 meters.No way to know if the damn thing is on until you hold the on/off button which obviously turns it off if it is on! Then you have to wait until it lets you press it again.Iffy quality control.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Ich habe das Headset nach defekt eingesendet und direkt noch einmal bekommen. Leider wieder das selbe Problem: erst ein paar mal ein knacken zu hören das immer stärker wird und kurz darauf völliger Ausfall des Tons.Das Headset Sitzt wunderbar, auch für große ihren zu empfehlen. Die Verarbeitung und der Ton sind auch klasse. Aber bei 280€ darf das Gerät nicht 2 mal in Folge defekt sein!

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Update 4/21/2023 - Headset mic now makes insane crackling when lowering. Replacing this headset. Lasted 3 months of heavy use (8 - 12 hours / day).Update 2/2/2023 - Dropping to 1 star. Headset constantly loses wireless connection even when sitting right next to the dongle. I bought this to be wireless, not wired to a desk. AVOID THIS HEADSETTL;DR - These look pretty, but the performance & software leaves a lot to be desired. For $200 less, you can get G935s that come with G-Hub which is wayyyyyyyyy better than "Epos Gaming Suite", they're not as good looking (IMO) but they perform way better than these.This review is as of Software version 1.11.0.1102, should future updates correct any of the issues I mentioned, I'll update my review.Looks - 5/5, A very gorgeous headset. I have the Matte Green / Gold combo. Detachable mic for public spaces make it more socially acceptable.Comfort - 4/5, Very comfy, you know you're wearing them, but by no means are they heavy like some. No digging into the top of the head or anything like that. Sticks to my head great, I've worn them to work out a couple times.Build quality - 5/5, seem sturdy, no complaints here.Sound quality 4/5 - With ANC off, it sounds great. Turn on ANC, and you hear this constant "white noise" static.Connectivity - 2/5, From time to time, the head set will get crackly for no reason after an extended period of use. When starting my day there are times where sound will not come through the head set unless I restart it once or twice. For some reason, the headset has trouble switching from PC to smartphone when making a call. Its 2023, why is this an issue? Bluetooth has been around for a while now... Lastly the dongle range is pretty bad. 10 feet and I get a lot of static and/or cutting in and out of audio. Much worse that my old G935's. Only edge they have here is that you can stream sound sources from bluetooth and the dongle at the same time (As long as its not a phone call).Software - 2/5. for $300, I expect to know exactly what my battery level is. The app simply tells you if its 80% or 40%. No exact %'s. my old G935's were able to, why is this even an issue? A whopping 4 sound presets. Movie, Esports, Music and Flat. You're able to select 2.0 or 7.1 surround effect and add reverb (why?). Otherwise still a lot to be desired from the software point of view.Battery life - 4/5, No complaints here other than what I mentioned about about the battery level indicator. Still has ~40% battery after a 10 hour work day with music playing all day.Microphone - 3/5 For some reason, after a long session I'll need to restart the headset because the mic feedback becomes 'roboty'. Incredibly annoying.Noise cancellation - 0/5, "ANC" as they call it here. Does absolutely nothing. If anything it seems to enhance the outside sound and create a "white noise" static in the background.Volume control - 2/5, annoying to say the least. Its a circle on the side of the headset that annoyingly difficult to adjust. Just make it a scroller wheel, much easier.Past headsets I've owned--Beyerdynaic MM150 (Best Mic & Noise Cancelling)-HyperX Cloud Stinger-Logitech G935 (Best software & sound)-Logitech G933-Corsair Void Pro RGB-Turtle Beach Ear Force XO

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: au bout d'une heure d'utilisation le micro se met sistematiquement a gresiller sur les 2 que j'ai recu a fuir

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Wireless range is really bag on these, when i was having issues with the Mic going robot sounding every 20-40mins Amazon was very helpful and contacted Epso who confirmed this is a known issue! they are selling faulty headphone, only way to fix it is taking the Mic off and on again, i explained im not going that in the middle of a game it should just work and returned the head set.£239 head set and you are told to take the mic off every time it goes wrong...... they said they are working on a firmware update but no date ....
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United States on 20 January 2023

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Took a risk in buying the Epos H3Pro Hybrid, which were more expensive than the average for the quality of the product. I got for 280€ :- a terrible software support, the EPOS Gaming Suite is still in my opinion a very lacking software in terms of features, functionnalities, quality of life, and ease of use.- an average battery life, considering the less expensive alternatives- Bad dongle connection, I have lost connection too many times to count while using the headset, and had to unplug replug the dongle, or switch off and on the headset, for it to work again.- Sound strongly lacking in bass.- Headset is comfortable, but the earpads are a bit too small for my taste, and cause ear pain after a while.- I sometimes hear a very high-pitched continuous sound in the left ear when I am not listening to anything, which might come from the antenna.- The volume wheel is horrible, it increments in steps that are way too large, and is bad design overall.- Microphone sound quality is average, if you want an excellent microphone, avoid this headset. The removable microphone option is good, and the pull up to mute function is appreciated, however.Overall, I regret my purchase, and if you hesitate between this headset or the logitech G pro x wireless, go for the logitech. Its microphone is much better, more software features and better battery life, and much less expensive.Tldr : too expensive for bad software, bad dongle connection, bad battery life, average microphone, and died after a year of use (in completely normal conditions, wasn't used for travel or heavy movement). Don't buy this headset.

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Das Headset liefert eine Gute Ton Qualität.Die Stimme wird Klar übertragen.Bindung an ein Handy Separat zum Pc und annehmen von Telefonaten Funktioniert und ist Super.Warum nur einen Stern?Ich habe mir das Headset geholt als Ersatz zu meinem Astro A50, leider habe ich nun nach 4 Monaten Probleme damit.Das Micro beginnt zu Rauschen und Knarzen wenn man den so genannten Boom Arm bewegt, es kommt zu Aussetzern und Ausfällen.Weil man damit Natürlich nicht Zufrieden ist habe ich mich an den EPOS Support gewendet und Hilfe gesucht.Dieser ist aber leider nicht willens zu Helfen, hier gab es nur Standart Fragen die Beantwortet von mir Wurden, Leider schweigt man sich hier nun aus und Support findet keiner mehr statt.Das ist bei einem Preis von über 200€ für ein Headset einfach nicht in Ordnung.
DateOfReview: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 February 2022

ProductName: EPOS H3PRO Hybrid Wireless Gaming Headset with Bluetooth and ANC, Detachable Boom Arm, Smart Button Audio Mixing, PC Playstation Xbox Nintendo Mobile Compatible (Sebring Black)
Review: Voila 3 mois que j'utilise ce casque quotidiennement et comme je l'ai écrit dans le titre il ne vaut pas sont prix compte tenue des défauts , certes il y a eu 2/3 mise a jour du firmware ainsi que du logiciel cela indique que le casque et suivit afin d'être améliorer mais les problèmes persiste ...Le surround est a gerber aucune immersion tu a juste l'impression d'avoir 2 boite de conserve qui te retransmettes le son, le VOID RGB ELITE de chez Corsair acheté a 50€ d'occasion faisait nettement mieuxLes profiles de base sont également horribles hormis le profil MUSICIl faut checker a chaque reconnexion les paramètres du micro si ils n'ont pas était changerQuand l'ANC est activer le son et clairement plus prononcé est immersif mais celui ci ne fait que grésiller a chaque son de basse ( Il suffit de mettre c'est 2 mains sur les 2 écouteurs comme si on ce boucher les oreilles pour que ce problème disparaisse ) mais est-ce vraiment normal et pratique ? je ne pense pas.J'ai une grosse tète et d'énormes oreilles ( que le grand Monsieur la haut m'en soit témoin ) et je porte ce casque a merveille il est assez confortable et beauLe micro est bon même si connecté via le dongle usb , j'hésite même a dire très bon car je n'en ai pas eu beaucoup hormis le PX22 de chez turtle beach mais je sais qu'il y a mieux donc bon c'est bien :)L'autonomie est très bonne et je trouve la charge assez rapide, de plus la câble est assez long pour ne pas être gênant quand la batterie est a platIl est prit en charge sur quasiment toutes les plateformes pour ne pas dire toutes ce qui est pratique pour passer de la console au pc mais encore sur mobile sans avoir besoin d'avoir un casque ou écouteur pour chaque plateforme en revanche aucun changement de profil possiblePour terminer je trouve le son très bon les basses prononcés et bien gérer mais seulement sur le profil music que je trouve d'ailleurs polyvalent selon le contenu consommer ( mais bon les gouts et les couleurs sont différents d'une personne a une autre ) peut être devrais-je prendre le temps de peaufiner manuellement qui sait
